page.title: 06Contrasts on Grimsby's Edge.
page.content: Squares 1,5,and 9 in our block offer great contrast in their land cover and amenities. Square 9 is covered with {arable farmland and woods.}Square 5 is also mostly{arable farmland,}but there is an unspoilt village,{Bradley,}which is situated on the borders of two administrative areas,{Grimsby,}and {Cleethorpes and District.}Square 1 is mostly{residential}with a large area set aside as an{Urban Recreational open space.{Transport}is part of the count because of the many small roads. Most of the amenities are centred on {Bradley Cross Roads}which is situated at the junction of the{A l8}and an unofficial ring road. Around the junction are two{garages,}various {shops,}a sub{post office}and a{public {house.}About{70%}of the population of the three squares is close to this road junction.{
